content:
• Friday, December 29, 2017
  • ADTN

    Adtran -14% after warning on Q4 earnings

    • Adtran (ADTN -14.3%) plunges to a 52-week low after issuing below consensus guidance for Q4, revising its revenue estimate to $125M from $155M-$165M earlier and seeing EPS of ~$0.01; analysts had expected EPS of ~$0.14 and revenue of $161.2M.
    • ADTN also expects Q1 to come in at roughly the same as Q4, below analyst consensus of $167.5M.
    • CEO Tom Stanton says Q4 results have been hurt by a merger-related review, which ADTN expects to be completed in 60-90 days, and slowdown in the spending at a domestic Tier 1 customer.
    • MKM Partners analyst Michael Genovese believes the customer is CenturyLink (CTL -2%), which accounted for 24% of ADTN's total sales in 2016.
    • The analyst thinks the weakness should prove temporary, adding that ADTN's performance likely will accelerate into 2019 as the company stands to benefit from 5G spending; MKM trims its ADTN target price to $25 from $27 but keeps its Buy rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 6 Comments

  • APHA

    Volatile day for Canadian marijuana stocks

    • Huge swings in Aphria (APHQF -5.4%), Aurora Cannabis (ACBFF +1.5%), Medreleaf (OTCPK:MEDFF -3.3%), WEED (OTCPK:BUDZ +7%) and Canopy Growth (TWMJF -10%) caused all five stocks to be halted this afternoon by exchanges in Canada.
    • Investors appears to be betting furiously on what the cannabis market will bring in 2018.
    • Previously: Legal marijuana arriving in California (Dec. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 145 Comments

  • MCEP

    Mid-Con Energy sells oil and gas assets, explores strategic alternatives

    • Mid-Con Energy Partners (MCEP -4%) says it sold oil and natural gas assets in its southern Oklahoma core area to Exponent Energy III for $22M.
    • MCEP also says it hired Sagent Advisors to help explore various financing and strategic alternatives, including potential acquisitions, corporate restructuring and merger opportunities.
    • MCEP says it is in discussions with lenders on an extension to its revolving credit facility as part of its review of financing alternatives.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 64 Comments

  • Consumers - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM

    • Gainers: KOSS +63%. LTEA +14%.FUV +10%.
    • Losers: WATT -16%. KBSF -14%. MPX -9%. REED -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 7 Comments
  • ANIP

    ANI Pharmaceuticals acquires four AstraZeneca NDAs

    • ANI Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ANIP) acquires the NDAs and U.S. marketing rights for AstraZeneca’s Atacand (hypertension), Atacand HCT, Arimidex (breast cancer), and Casodex (prostate cancer).
    • ANI paid $46.5M in cash, royalties, and sales-based milestones.
    • The products generated a combined $19M in sales during the TTM through October.  
    • ANI also announces entering a new five-year senior secured credit facility for up to $125M. 
    • The facility with Citizens Bank includes a $75M five-year term loan that closed today in support of the NDA purchase. 
    • ANI shares are up 1.1%.  
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 4 Comments
  • MYL

    Mylan +1% on launch of Estrace generic

    • Mylan (NASDAQ:MYL) announces the U.S. launch of Estradiol Vaginal Cream USP, 0.01%, which is the first generic version of Allergan’s Estrace.
    • The product treats vulvar and vaginal atrophy. 
    • Estradiol had U.S. sales of about $449M for the twelve months ending October 31. 
    • Mylan shares are up 1%.       
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 2 Comments
  • GNC

    GNC Holdings rallies after Fitch update

    • Fitch Ratings upgrades its default rating on GNC Holdings (GNC +10.1%) to CCC from RD (restricted default) on completion of the company's debt exchange. GNC's senior secured facility is lowered to B-/RR2 from B+/RR2.
    • Fitch on GNC: "While GNC's exchange modestly reduces the company's total debt burden, it also highlights GNC's challenges in addressing upcoming maturities after recent operating declines and the December 2017 withdrawal of its proposed credit facility refinancing. Fitch remains concerned about the company's ability to address upcoming maturities ($300 million revolver due September 2018 and $1.1 billion term loan maturity in March 2019). GNC's inability to successfully address its upcoming maturities in a timely fashion would be a rating concern."
    • Full Fitch report
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 6 Comments
  • SYNT

    Syntel -5.4% on Wells Fargo downgrade

    • Wells Fargo downgrades Syntel (NASDAQ:SYNT) from Market Perform to Underperform with a $21 price target.
    • Analyst Ed Caso cites weak positioning in the shifting info tech demand, price pressure on legacy offerings, and limited upside on operating margin.   
    • Syntel shares are down 5.4% to $22.86, which is nearly 9% higher than the Wells Fargo price target.    
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • SLS

    Galena stockholders OK merger with SELLAS Life Sciences

    • Galena Biopharama (GALE +8.6%) is higher after shareholders approve the company's merger deal with SELLAS Life Sciences.
    • GALE also says it will implement a reverse stock split of its common shares at a 1‑for-30 ratio, to become effective after today's close.
    • The continuing company, which will be renamed SELLAS Life Sciences, will begin trading on NASDAQ on a post-reverse split basis under the new SLS ticker on Tue., Jan. 2.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 8 Comments
  • DCTH

    Delcath updates on convertible note agreement

    • Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH +21.2%) announces that it entered into exchange agreements with an investor from its June 2016 private placement of senior secured convertible notes to extinguish outstanding obligations.
    • The agreement sees a release of restrictions on cash held in control accounts and the issuance of shares.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 9 Comments

  • TIVO

    TheStreet: TiVo gets buyout interest at more than $20/share

    • TiVo (TIVO +10.4%) spikes higher following a report by TheStreet.com that several potential P-E buyers have expressed interest in a buyout that would value the company at ~$2.5B.
    • The buyers reportedly offered slightly more than $20/share, significantly higher than yesterday's $14 closing price.
    • TiVo has not launched a strategic review process, according to the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 14 Comments
  • AZN

    AstraZeneca +2.1% on JPMorgan upgrade

    • JPMorgan Chase upgrades AstraZeneca (NYSE:AZN) from Neutral to Overweight.
    • Analyst Richard Vosser cites a strong 2018 growth trajectory for the company after lessened downside risks from the MYSTIC trial failure and exaggerated base business expectations. 
    • AstraZeneca shares are up 2.1%.  
    • Previously: AstraZeneca down 15% premarket on failed late-stage study on lung cancer candidate durvalumab; Merck up 5% on improved prospects for Keytruda (July 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • WLB

    Government says it wrongly announced Westmoreland mine expansion

    • Westmoreland Coal (WLB -5.4%) sinks following yesterday's news that the U.S. Department of the Interior incorrectly announced approval of the company's expansion of its Rosebud mine in Montana.
    • The Department said an “internal miscommunication” led to the incorrect announcement last week about the mine expansion, and the project remains under review.
    • WLB shares surged nearly 50% in intraday trading Tuesday on the belief that the mine expansion had been approved.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 3 Comments
  • MSRT

    MassRoots pops on blockchain pivot

    • MassRoots (OTCQB:MSRT +22.7%) pops after announcing that it formed the MassRoots Blockchain Technologies subsidiary to developing blockchain-based solutions for the cannabis industry.
    • "We believe blockchain has the potential to enable the cannabis industry to operate more efficiently and with a greater degree of accountability and transparency," says MassRoots CEO Isaac Dietrich.
    • Investors seem to agree with volume on MSRT already 2X normal daily activity.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 29 Comments
  • WATT

    Citron Research tweets Energous' "history of deception"; shares drop 6.4%

    • Energous (NASDAQ:WATT) shares drop 6.4% after short-seller Citron Research calls out the company’s “history of deception” on Twitter.
    • Full Citron tweet: “Co has a history of deception and the recent FCC info is no different. Tech is not ready for primetime and the loss of Apple for Dialog, death to the rumor. Roth upgrade was as ridic as their defense of Unipixel until BK. Powercast at CES will expose why WATT to $15.” 
    • Background: Energous and Powercast both received FCC certification for wire-free charging technology this week. The companies will each present at CES in January.
    • Apple is reported designing its own power-management chips for future iPhones, which cut Dialog Semiconductor out of the supply chain, and went with the competing Qi standard for wireless charging. Citron suggests these movements end rumors that Energous could become an Apple supplier. 
    • Citron also advises not to listen to Roth’s defense of Energous as the firm defended Uni-Pixel ahead of its bankruptcy earlier this year.        
    • Previously: Energous +63% on FCC certification (Dec. 26)
    • Previously: Roth Capital raises its Energous price target; FCC chair tweets confirmation (Dec. 28)
    • Previously: Energous competitor receives FCC approval (Dec. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 94 Comments
  • GCAP

    'Super spike' in Gain Capital possible today, says bull; shares up another 28%

    • Gain Capital (NYSE:GCAP) rose more than 25% yesterday after Richard Pearson picked the broker as a blockchain play with an actual real business.
    • Shares are up another 28% in premarket action, with Pearson suggesting a "super spike" as possible in the year's final trading session.
    • He notes the "Dinner Table Effect," in which crypto assets spiked higher following Thanksgiving and Xmas. Markets adjust quickly, and he now expects traders to buy in front of New Year's.
    • There's also the "let it ride" effect - with many sitting on big gains, why sell today and have taxes due with your 2018 return, when selling on Tuesday means taxes would be deferred until 2019?
    • Previously: Gain Capital up 10% on Mox Capital boost (Dec. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM | 3 Comments

  • PGNX

    Progenics Pharmaceuticals +21% on NDA acceptance

    • Progenics Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PGNX) announces that the FDA has accepted for review its New Drug Application for rare neuroendocrine tumor treatment Azedra.
    • The FDA also granted the request for priority review and set the PDUFA date for April 30. 
    • Progenics shares are up 20.5% premarket.  
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM | 29 Comments

    • LIVE -8%.
    • LINU-OLD -7%.
    • FH -5%.

  • TEUM

    Pareteum appoints CTO and COO

    • Pareteum (NYSEMKT:TEUM) appoints Ali Davachi as CTO and COO.
    • Davachi previously worked as the Chief Information Security Officer and SVP of Technology at Scivantage and founded Realware. 
    • Pareteum shares are up 11.7% premarket. 
    • Previously: Parateum adds cryptocurrency support, shares +61% (Dec. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • AVDL

    Avadel pharmaceuticals issues 2018 corporate outlook

    • Avadel Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AVDL) announces its 2018 corporate objectives and financial expectations.
    • For 2018, the Company has set forth the following expectations:
    • Commercial launch for Noctiva during Q2 2018.
    • NDA filing for FT218 by end of 2018 and for AV001 in 2019.
    • Total Revenues expected in the range of $110M - $130M.
    • R&D and SG&A Expenses in the range of $40M - $50M and $85M - $95M respectively.
    • Avadel is progressing in enrolling patients for its REST-ON Phase III clinical trial.
    • 2017 Total Revenues in the range of $165M to $175M and EPS at the top end of its adjusted EPS guidance of $0.25 to $0.35.
    • Shares are down 7% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM | 5 Comments
  • RENN

    Renren will acquire trucking app company

    • Renren (NYSE:RENN) will acquire Trucker Path, a social platform provider for the U.S. trucking industry. No financial terms were disclosed.
    • Trucker Path created the Trucker Path app for trip planning including real-time updates of points of interest including parking, rest areas, and DOT weight stations. 
    • Renren shares are up 2.9% premarket.       
    • Related ETFs: EMQQ, KEMQ, SOCL.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM | 3 Comments
  • IBM

    IBM, Priceline settle lengthy patent lawsuit

    • IBM (NYSE:IBM) and Priceline (PCLN) resolve the patent lawsuit with a confidential settlement and cross-licenses to each other’s patent portfolio.
    • The patent case goes back to 2015 with the patents in question stretching back to the early days of the internet. 
    • IBM accused Priceline (and its affiliates Kayak and OpenTable) of violating patents for the pre-World Wide Web online service Prodigy. 
    • The patents related to app and ad displays based more on the user computer than the service’s servers. 
    • In September of this year, a judge handed out a complicated split ruling in the case that likely led to the settlement.   
    • IBM shares are up 0.3%.    
     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM
  • DPW

    Digital Power +5.7% on annual meeting details

    • Digital Power (NYSEMKT:DPW) releases details about its annual shareholder meeting including the approved reorganization strategy and name change to DPW Holdings, effective at the close of business today.
    • The company says its December 31 balance sheet will include $2.5M in cash and securities, short-term debt of $4M, and conversion of Series C stock into common stock. 
    • Digital Power shares are up 5.7% premarket.  
    • Previously: Digital Power launches crypto mining division; shares up 30% (Dec. 13)
    • Previously: Digital Power +11.3% on cryptocurrency mining addition (Dec. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:23 AM | 8 Comments
